article_title: CHI St. Luke's Health System selects a new leader
article_text: To continue reading this story, you will need to be a digital subscriber to HoustonChronicle.com.

og.description:
Catholic Health Initiatives on Tuesday named Michael Covert as CEO of Houston's CHI St. Luke's Health System, which includes a Texas Medical Center flagship and five other Houston-area hospitals.
Since 2003, Covert has been president and CEO of San Diego-based Palomar Health, a $1.5 billion health care system that includes three hospitals, two nursing homes, home health agencies, a medical foundation and a fund- raising organization. Palomar recently became part of the Mayo Clinic Care Network.
Covert, 65, also will be a senior vice president for Catholic Health Initiatives, which purchased St. Luke's Health last year, when he starts work in late August.
og.title: CHI St. Luke's Health System selects a new leader
